note: The Lemma 11.2 argument is flawed (as noted in challenge ch-46f1da73509033fe), but the CONCLUSION is CORRECT via cycle-structure analysis: In Case 2, B must be subset of supp(g_1) and contain all tail elements {a_i}. For n>=2, consecutive elements cause contradiction. For n=1, |B|=1 (trivial). Thus Case 2 always leads to contradiction.
